TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ImageKeyConverter extends System.ComponentModel.StringConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert data for an image key to and from another data type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ImageKeyConverter class is used to convert key values of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> to and from other data types. For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!NOTE] > Typically, you do not directly create an instance of an ImageKeyConverter. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter/StandardValuesCollection GetStandardValues(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context, which can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from. This parameter or properties of this parameter can be .
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of standard image keys for the image list associated with the specified context.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection> that contains the standard set of image key values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If no image list is found, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter> supports `null` as a standard value, the GetStandardValues method returns a collection containing a single empty string. If no image list is found, and `null` is not supported as a standard value, GetStandardValues returns an empty collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool GetStandardValuesExclusive(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context, which can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from. This parameter or properties of this parameter can be .
Docs.summary: Determines whether the list of standard values for the is exclusive (that is, whether it allows values other than those returned by <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter.GetStandardValues%2A>).
Docs.returns: to indicate the list does not allow additional values; otherwise, . Always returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the list returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method is exclusive, no other values are valid. This is typical of an enumerated data type. If the list is not exclusive, there are other valid values besides the list of standard values that <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> provides.
As implemented in this type converter, this method always returns `true`.
Typically, you should call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported%2A> method before you attempt to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive%2A> methods.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool GetStandardValuesSupported(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context, which can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from. This parameter or properties of this parameter can be .
Docs.summary: Determines whether this type converter supports a standard set of values that can be picked from a list.
Docs.returns: to indicate a list of standard values is supported; otherwise, . Always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks As implemented in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter> class, the GetStandardValuesSupported method always returns `true` since <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter> supports a standard set of index values for images that can be picked from a list.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether is valid in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection> collection.
Docs.value: in all cases, indicating is valid in the standard values collection.
